com.palantir.giraffe.file

Class MoreFiles

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.palantir.giraffe.file.MoreFiles

  • public final class MoreFiles
extends Object
    Provides static methods that extend the functionality provided by Files.

      • regularFileFilter

      • directoryFilter

        public static DirectoryStream.Filter<Path> directoryFilter()

      • deleteRecursive

        public static void deleteRecursive(Path path)
                            throws IOException
        Deletes a path recursively.

        If the path is a file or an empty directory, this method is equivalent to Files.delete(Path). If the path is a non-empty directory, the directory, all sub-directories, and all child files are deleted.

        This operation is not atomic with respect to other file system operations. As a result, the path may be left in a partially-deleted state if this method fails.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to delete
        Throws:
        NoSuchFileException - if the path does not exist
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while deleting the path

      • deleteRecursiveIfExists

        public static boolean deleteRecursiveIfExists(Path path)
                                       throws IOException
        Deletes a path recursively if it exists.

        If the path is a file or an empty directory, this method is equivalent to Files.deleteIfExists(Path). If the path is a non-empty directory, the directory, all sub-directories, and all child files are deleted.

        This operation is not atomic with respect to other file system operations. As a result, the path may be left in a partially-deleted state if this method fails.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to delete
        Returns:
        true if the path was deleted by this method, false if the path did not exist
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while deleting the path

      • copyLarge

        public static void copyLarge(Path source,
             Path target)
                      throws IOException
        Copy a file to a target file in an efficient way.

        This method is equivalent to Files.copy(source, target, StandardCopyOptions.REPLACE_EXISTING), but may be significantly faster depending on the file systems of the source and the target.

        Parameters:
        source - the file to copy
        target - the target file
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if source is not a regular file or target is a directory.
        IOException - if an IO error occurs while copying

      • copyRecursive

        public static void copyRecursive(Path source,
                 Path target)
                          throws IOException
        Copy a path to a target path recursively.

        If the source is a file or empty directory, this method is equivalent to Files.copy(source, target). If the source is a non-empty directory, the directory and all descendants are copied to the target path. The destination must not exist.

        If an IOException occurs while copying files and directories, this method may leave a partial copy at the target path. Users may catch these exceptions and recursively delete the target path if this is a problem.

        Parameters:
        source - the path to copy
        target - the target path
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the destination already exists or one or more parent directories do not exist.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while copying

      • readAllString

        public static String readAllString(Path path,
                   Charset cs)
                            throws IOException
        Reads the contents of a file as a string.
        Parameters:
        path - the file to read
        cs - the charset to use for decoding
        Returns:
        a string containing the full contents of the file
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading a file
        See Also:
        Files.readAllBytes(Path)

        Parameters:

        string - the string to write
        cs - the charset to use for encoding
        options - options specifying how the file is opened
        Returns:
        the path
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file
        See Also:

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(Path path)
                       throws IOException
        Test if the given path is empty. Directories are empty if they contain no entries. Files are empty if they exist and their size is zero. Paths that do not exist are always empty.
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        true if the path is empty
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while accessing the path

      • listDirectory

        public static List<Path> listDirectory(Path directoryPath)
                                throws IOException
        Given a Path representing a directory, retrieve the list of files and directories contained in that Path as a List. The Path objects are obtained as if by resolving the name of the directory objects against the given Path.
        Parameters:
        directoryPath - The Path to get the directory entries for
        Returns:
        A list of Path objects representing the directory entries
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while accessing the path

      • isLocal

        public static boolean isLocal(Path path)
        Determines if the given path is associated with the default (local) file system.
